about.title: About Quiz
about.description: Quiz is a free, privacy-first live quiz tool. Create interactive quizzes, share a join code, and compete in real-time — all without accounts or tracking.
about.step1: Create a quiz with multiple-choice questions
about.step2: Share the join code or link with participants
about.step3: Control the quiz flow as the presenter
about.step4: Participants answer in real-time and see the leaderboard
about.privacyText: All quiz content is end-to-end encrypted. The encryption key is stored in the URL fragment and never sent to our servers. Quizzes automatically expire after the time you choose.
about.openSourceText: Quiz is part of the switch-to.eu platform, helping users find and use EU-based digital tools.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Quiz is designed with privacy at its core. Here's how we handle your data.

encryption.title: End-to-End Encryption
encryption.description: All quiz content (questions, answers, options) is encrypted in your browser before being sent to our servers. We never see or store your quiz content in readable form.

data.title: What We Store
data.description: We store encrypted quiz data, participant nicknames, and answer timestamps. All data is automatically deleted when the quiz expires.

noTracking.title: No Tracking
noTracking.description: We don't use cookies, analytics, or any form of tracking. No accounts are required.

expiration.title: Automatic Expiration
expiration.description: All quizzes are automatically deleted after the expiration time you choose (1 hour to 7 days).

hero.title: MCP Integration
hero.subtitle: Create and manage quizzes directly from AI assistants like Claude, Cursor, and other MCP-compatible tools.

whatIsMcp.title: What is MCP?
whatIsMcp.description: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that lets AI assistants interact with external tools and services. Quiz exposes an MCP endpoint that allows AI agents to create quizzes, add and edit questions, and manage the full quiz lifecycle — all without leaving your AI workflow.

createQuiz.description: Create a new quiz with questions. Returns an admin URL (containing the encryption key and admin token) plus a join URL for participants.

getQuiz.description: Get the full details of a quiz including all decrypted questions, participants, and state. Requires the admin URL.

addQuestion.description: Add a new question to an existing quiz (must be in lobby state). Requires the admin URL.

updateQuestion.description: Update an existing question in a quiz (must be in lobby state). Requires the admin URL.

removeQuestion.description: Remove a question from a quiz (must be in lobby state). Remaining questions are re-indexed. Requires the admin URL.

deleteQuiz.description: Permanently delete a quiz and all its data. This cannot be undone. Requires the admin URL.

params.title: (required) — The quiz title
params.questions: (required) — Array of questions with text, options, correctIndex, and optional timerOverride
params.timerSeconds: (optional, default: 20) — Default timer per question in seconds (0 = no timer)
params.expirationHours: (optional, default: 24) — Hours until the quiz expires (1–168)
params.adminUrl: (required) — The admin URL returned when the quiz was created

adminKey.title: About the Admin URL
adminKey.description: When you create a quiz via MCP, the AI assistant receives the admin URL which contains both the encryption key and admin token. This URL is not stored on the server — it only exists in the AI's conversation memory. Depending on which AI tool you use, be aware that the admin URL may persist in your conversation history. Only create quizzes through trusted AI tools and treat the admin URL like a password.

claudeDesktop.title: Claude Desktop
claudeDesktop.description: Add the following to your Claude Desktop configuration file. On macOS this is at ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json
claudeDesktop.note: Requires mcp-remote (installed automatically via npx) to bridge stdio to HTTP.

cursor.title: Cursor / Windsurf
cursor.description: Add a .cursor/mcp.json or .windsurf/mcp.json file to your project root. These editors support streamable HTTP natively.

claudeCode.title: Claude Code
claudeCode.description: Add a .mcp.json file to your project root or home directory.

security.title: Security Note
security.description: All quiz content is encrypted with AES-256-GCM before storage — the server never sees the plaintext. When creating or managing quizzes via MCP, the encryption key and admin token travel through the MCP protocol. Only use this with trusted AI tools and share quiz join links (not admin links) with participants.
